abstract: Pressure from shareholders has led a subcommittee of the Dell Inc. board of directors to ask the company’s founder, Michael S. Dell, to raise his offer to take the company private.
snippet: Pressure from shareholders has led a subcommittee of the Dell Inc. board of directors to ask the company’s founder, Michael S. Dell, to raise his offer to take the company private.
lead_paragraph: Michael S. Dell may have to dig deeper into his pockets if he wants his $24.4 billion bid for the computer company he founded to succeed.

headline.main: Michael Dell Is Said to Be Encouraged by Board to Raise Offer
headline.print_headline: Dell Founder Is Said To Be Encouraged To Raise Bid

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
